extendedIngredients.name: cracked wheat
extendedIngredients.original: 1 tsp. cracked black or white peppercorns

extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.original: 1-1/2 lb. jumbo shrimp (about 20), rinsed, shelled (tails left on), deveined, and patted dry

title: Curry-mint Rubbed Jumbo Shrimp
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Curry-mint Rubbed Jumbo Shrimp a try. One portion of this dish contains about 24g of protein, 2g of fat, and a total of 125 calories. This recipe serves 4. For $2.43 per serving, this recipe covers 13% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. A mixture of cracked, garlic, jumbo shrimp, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so tasty. To use up the curry powder you could follow this main course with the Curry Ice Cream with Mango and Pistachio as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. It is a good option if you're following a dairy free and pescatarian diet. With a spoonacular score of 44%, this dish is pretty good. Try Jumbo Shrimp With Bok Choy, Stuffed Jumbo Shrimp, and Grilled Jumbo Shrimp for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. One wine you could try is Thrive Pinot Grigio. It has 4.5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 15 dollars.

instructions: Heat the broiler or prepare a grill fire. In a large bowl, combine the coriander, mint, curry powder, garlic, ginger, peppercorns, and salt. Toss the shrimp with the rub and then thread them onto skewers. Broil or grill until just opaque and cooked through, 5 to 6 minutes, turning once.                  nutrition information (per serving):        Calories                        (kcal):                      120, Fat                        (kcal):                      1.5, Fat Calories                        (g):                      15, Saturated Fat                        (g):                      0.5, Protein                        (g):                      25, Monounsaturated Fat                        (g):                      0.5, Carbohydrates                        (mg):                      2, Polyunsaturated Fat                        (mg):                      0.5, Sodium                        (g):                      410, Cholesterol                        (g):                      225, Fiber                        (g):                      1,                     Photo: Scott Phillips          Rate this Recipe and View Reviews

steps.step: Heat the broiler or prepare a grill fire. In a large bowl, combine the coriander, mint, curry powder, garlic, ginger, peppercorns, and salt. Toss the shrimp with the rub and then thread them onto skewers. Broil or grill until just opaque and cooked through, 5 to 6 minutes, turning once.
